# John Gourley

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

John Gourley  
---  
[![John Baldwin Gourley at 2010 Sasquatch!
Festival.jpg](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/John_Baldwin_Gourley_at_2010_Sasquatch%21_Festival.jpg/300px-
John_Baldwin_Gourley_at_2010_Sasquatch%21_Festival.jpg)](/wiki/File:John_Baldwin_Gourley_at_2010_Sasquatch!_Festival.jpg)
John Gourley at 2010 Sasquatch! Festival  
Background information  
Birth name | John Baldwin Gourley  
Also known as | The Fantastic The  
Born | 1981 (age 35–36)  
[Willow, Alaska](/wiki/Willow,_Alaska "Willow, Alaska"), United States[1]  
Origin | [Portland](/wiki/Portland,_Oregon "Portland, Oregon"), Oregon, United States  
Genres | 

  * [Rock](/wiki/Rock_music "Rock music")
  * [post-hardcore](/wiki/Post-hardcore "Post-hardcore")

  
Occupation(s) | 

  * Musician
  * singer
  * songwriter

  
Instruments | Vocal, Guitar  
Years active | 2002–present  
Associated acts | 

  * [Anatomy of a Ghost](/wiki/Anatomy_of_a_Ghost "Anatomy of a Ghost")
  * [Portugal. The Man](/wiki/Portugal._The_Man "Portugal. The Man")

  
  
**John Baldwin Gourley** (born 1981) is an American musician, singer, and
songwriter from Alaska. He is the lead singer and guitarist in the Portland,
Oregon rock band [Portugal. The Man](/wiki/Portugal._The_Man "Portugal. The
Man"). Gourley was previously the lead singer in [screamo](/wiki/Screamo
"Screamo") punk band, [Anatomy of a Ghost](/wiki/Anatomy_of_a_Ghost "Anatomy
of a Ghost").[2] Gourley is also a visual artist, who often uses the alias The
Fantastic The.[3]

## Contents

[hide]

  * 1 Early life
  * 2 References
  * 3 Further reading
  * 4 External links

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=John_Gourley&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Gourley was born in 1981 to John T. Gourley and Jennifer.[4][5] He and his two
siblings grew up in [Alaska](/wiki/Alaska "Alaska") moving from town to town,
wherever their father's contracting business took the family.[4][6] Gourley's
parents both competed in the [Iditarod](/wiki/Iditarod "Iditarod"), and for a
while the family lived in a remote "off the grid" cabin accessible only by
dogsled.[4][7] He grew up helping to take care of dozens of
[mushing](/wiki/Mushing "Mushing") dogs.

He attended [Wasilla High School](/wiki/Wasilla_High_School "Wasilla High
School"), but dropped out at age 15 to study at home and work in construction
with his father.[4][8]

Gourley joined four fellow [Wasilla](/wiki/Wasilla,_Alaska "Wasilla, Alaska")
musicians: his best friend Zach Carothers and the three members of band Nice
Guy Eddie (Dewey Halpaus, Joe Simon, and Nick Simon), to form punk band
[Anatomy of a Ghost](/wiki/Anatomy_of_a_Ghost "Anatomy of a Ghost") in
2002.[5][9] They toured across the country and released their album
_[Evanesce](/wiki/Evanesce_\(album\) "Evanesce \(album\)")_ in October 2003 on
[Fearless Records](/wiki/Fearless_Records "Fearless Records"). The members
wanted to pursue their own ideas, however, so the band split up in May 2004.
Gourley and bassist Carothers formed the nucleus of [Portugal. The
Man](/wiki/Portugal._The_Man "Portugal. The Man").[10]
